events.event_description: China's diesel consumption fell to 3.9 million barrels per day in June 2024, marking an 11% decline from the previous year and the largest year-over-year decline since July 2021.
events.citation: Our estimates of diesel consumption in China totaled 3.9 million barrels per day (b/d) in June 2024, a decline of 11% from the same month last year and the largest year-over-year decline in consumption for any month since July 2021.

events.event_description: China's GDP grew 4.7% in Q2 2024, falling short of the government's 5% target, indicating slower economic growth.
events.citation: China's GDP grew 4.7% from last year in the second quarter of 2024, a bit less than the government target of 5%.

events.event_description: LNG truck sales in China reached approximately 20% of total truck sales from Q3 2023 through March 2024, indicating a shift away from diesel fuel.
events.citation: According to data and analysis from BloombergNEF, LNG truck sales have made up around 20% of total truck sales from the third quarter of 2023 through March 2024.

events.event_description: EIA reduced China's forecast petroleum consumption growth in its August Short-Term Energy Outlook, projecting growth of 0.3 million b/d in 2024 and 2025.
events.citation: We slightly reduced our forecast petroleum consumption growth in China in our August Short-Term Energy Outlook. We forecast China's petroleum and liquid fuels consumption will grow by about 0.3 million b/d in 2024 and in 2025.
